title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-12.7 - Automatic-maximum firing rate over 20 gallons per hour
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 4-12.7 - Automatic-maximum firing rate over 20 gallons per hour

State Regulations

The burner shall be equipped with a proved pilot and the
pilot trial-for-ignition period shall not exceed 15 seconds. The burner shall
be so designed and installed that the main oil valve shall open only after the
pilot is proven and either such pilot shall automatically shut off within 60
seconds after the main oil valve opens or the pilot sensing device shall be
automatically de-energized. The main flame trial-for-ignition period shall not
exceed 60 seconds and the main flame shall be continually supervised while the
burner is firing. The electrical circuit to the main fuel valve shall be
automatically de-energized within four seconds after flame failure and the
de-energized valve shall close automatically within the next five
seconds. Notes
